DataElement.preferredName: Genomic Medicine Implementation Genetic Testing Outcome Family Communication Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A medical discipline that uses genomic information about an individual as part of their clinical care (e.g. for diagnostic or therapeutic decision-making) and for the health outcomes and policy implications of that clinical use. (NIH/NHGRI)_The act of carrying into effect._The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder._The result of an action._A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption._the exchange of information between objects, people, or groups.__a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: Questions to determine if the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Questions to determine if the respondent shared genetic test results with family members, and why it was important to share the results.
